revealed_symptoms.evolving: This thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before.
revealed_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
revealed_symptoms.border irregularity: The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles.
revealed_symptoms.nodule formation: It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles.
revealed_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
revealed_symptoms.induration: It feels thicker or harder than the rest of my skin, like there's something under there.
revealed_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
revealed_symptoms.ulceration: It’s like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.

hidden_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.
hidden_symptoms.shiny or waxy bump: It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.
hidden_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.
hidden_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, I've got this thing that keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. Also, one side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven. And the edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles. It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles. I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks. It feels thicker or harder than the rest of my skin, like there's something under there. It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. Finally, It’s like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.

Thank you for providing such a detailed description. Based on what you've told me, I'd like to ask a few more questions to better understand the mole. Have you noticed any changes in the color of the mole, like if it has become darker, lighter, or if different shades of color have appeared?
I haven't really paid attention to the color, so I don't know.
Okay, thank you. Has the mole ever itched or bled?
No, it hasn’t itched. It is like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.
Thank you. That is helpful. Does anyone in your immediate family have a history of skin cancer?

Thank you. Based on your description of the mole and our discussion, I am concerned about the possibility of melanoma. Given the characteristics you've described, I recommend further evaluation and a biopsy to confirm the diagnosis. I will provide you with a referral to a dermatologist. Do you have any questions?
No, I don’t have any questions right now.
